intro: Prunus serrulata f. semperflorens, commonly known as the Japanese cherry blossom or some varieties as the double-flowered cherry, is a cultivar of the Prunus serrulata species. It is characterized by its dense, double flowers that bloom in early spring, often in shades of white, pink, or red. The plant is a deciduous shrub or small tree, typically reaching heights of 3 to 6 meters. Its leaves are oval and serrated, providing an ornamental appearance throughout the growing season. The botanical features make it a popular ornamental plant in gardens and parks, especially in regions with temperate climates.
